website_summaries.verdict: While it isn't perfect, the Logitech Harmony 890 should be near the top of your list if you're in the market for a sub-$400 RF remote that can operate equipment that's hidden behind cabinets or closet doors.
pros: Logitech's first universal learning remote to incorporate both IR (infrared) and RF (radio frequency) wireless operation includes a rechargeable battery and docking station, an RF base station, a DVR-friendly button layout and backlit keys
As with other Harmony remotes, the Logitech 890 is Web-programmable and is compatible with Windows and Macintosh machines
cons: Compared to the IR-only 880, the Logitech Harmony 890 is pricey
Its Web interface may intimidate nontechie users, and it lacks the Wi-Fi connectivity that's beginning to appear on some rival high-end remotes

customer_reviews.title: Defective remote
customer_reviews.text: This 890 would not update past 25%, and when it finally did (once only) many of the buttons either did nothing or required very hard pressure to get a response. My old 890 that I had hoped to replace works better than this one, so it's going back. It acted like a repaired unit, not a brand new one. I've had many Harmony remotes and they've all worked perfectly right out of the box. This one did not come in a consumer package, but it did come in a Logitech logo cardboard box.
customer_reviews.author: steveindanville

customer_reviews.title: good product until you need help
customer_reviews.text: When this remote is working and once it's programmed, it's fantastic and really simplifies a complex home AV system. However, the set-up can be problematic and requires tech support to access certain programming features. tech support is AWFUL. (2 calls over 140 minutes of hold time!) They say they will call back, but have never done so. And when the product fails (this is our second, both of which lost LCD function unexplicably; ie no drops, spills, or power surges), Logitech simply tells you to buy a new one from them with a 50% off coupon. Unfortunately, buying from them cost almost 2x as much as buying it from Amazon. Again, great product, but TERRIBLE support and problem response.
customer_reviews.author: ShaunP

customer_reviews.title: Watch our for a nightmare!
customer_reviews.text: The written claims for the product proved not to be true (RF does not work with Bose) even if I could have completed installation. I found this product nearly impossible to install. And, the technical support, while courteous, was totally inadequate. The out of the box instructions failed to work even after repeated tries. The support suggestions indicated that the approach I should have taken (nothing like the written instructions)included taking out the battery before plugging the USB connector, turning off my virus protection, and trying an alternative web approach. None of these worked. After four hours wasted trying to make this work I gave up. Way bad for a consumer product.
customer_reviews.author: T. Hoisington

customer_reviews.title: Sweet remote, for anyone who can follow instruction
customer_reviews.text: The 890 is definitely a great remote for being user friendly, and though no matter what you do.... there's bound to be issues, the remote helps you solve them. Let's say you turn on the system with the remote, and your kids turn off parts of the system by hand (not with remote), the next time you push an activity on the remote, you don't get what you were desiring. By simply pushing the "help" button, the remote asks you a couple questions, and your off and running again. Haven't tried the Zwave technology yet, but am planning on putting a plug in module on my subwoofer, as it doesn't turn on/off with the system currently.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Weller

customer_reviews.title: Does it all!
customer_reviews.text: I read a ton of reviews on this remote and despite a few negative ones like the remote not charging right on the cradle. Ignore them all!! I have yet to find one negative comment to make on this remote. I have not had any problems with the cradle/charger, or the setup software. It did take a while to set up but it was very easy. Press of a single button and everything that I want turned on turns on, even with the proper inputs and sound settings! I have everything behind cabinet doors so nothing is seen and the emmiters work great. No regrets on this purchase and would purchase one again if the need would arise.
customer_reviews.author: J. Ruiz

customer_reviews.title: Good remote, but doesn't last
customer_reviews.text: I really tried hard to make this remote work. WHEN it works, it's as advertised. But over two years, I went through several remotes, each of which had some sort of hardware malfunction. Finally, I gave up. I'm currently using the Monster equivalent (MONSTER MCC AVL300-S Home Theater & Lighting Controller 300 With Omnilink), which uses the familiar Harmony software--a huge plus. So far, no problems. I prefer the layout of its buttons; the display isn't nearly as nice as Harmony's. All in all, a push. But if it doesn't break every six months, it's a huge improvement over this model.
customer_reviews.author: vs

customer_reviews.title: Harmony 890 review
customer_reviews.text: This product works well...when it works. When it doesn't, expect a phone call to tech support. In my experience, This product works great most of the time but looses a conection with the RF extender and can be difficult to get back. The software is a bit confusing and could be easier to use. Every change or upgrade to the remote requires you to also disconnect the RF extender from your components and connect it to the computer as well as the remote. Battery life could be better. All in all this is a pretty good remote with a few problems. Firmware and upgrades will hopefully solve the problems.
customer_reviews.author: A. wright

customer_reviews.title: Not Very Durable
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased several of the Logitech Harmony remotes in addition to this one. When these things work they are great. But beware that they stop working after 3-4 years. One of them the screen just stopped working, another couldn't be updated through its USB connection and another resulted in the remote just stopping. The last one I purchased is already showing signs of problems after 8 months. The screen will just go blank. When you add up the cost of replacing the remote it isn't worth the convenience that they offer.
customer_reviews.author: FlagGal

customer_reviews.title: Not too shabby
customer_reviews.text: I've had this remote for about 2 months now and it's great. It does take awhile to set up but once you get it going it's wonderful to control equipment hidden in closets or behind cabinets. The only thing I would have liked more is if you could control more devices and I do have some problems with the recharging cradle at times. Other than that no real complaints. It's great to be able to turn on different entertainment systems throughout the house with one press of a button (once its all programmed of course) and once fully recharged it lasts for days!
customer_reviews.author: Rick I.

customer_reviews.title: No more confusion about inputs
customer_reviews.text: We recently switched to using the Harmony 890 and it makes using all of our components much easier....no more remembering what to set the inputs to for certain devises....no more leaving the cabinet door open to change the volume on the receiver. Easy to use, easy to correct issues. Only problem is that the remote doesn't work all of our dvr functions properly....I just need to take the time to call Logitech and talk to the service department. As a note...it did take my brother in law (who lives for this kind of stuff) quite a while to set up.
customer_reviews.author: D. L. D

customer_reviews.title: Just like new
customer_reviews.text: This device is several years old, because they stopped making them, and it it like new. Thank you,
customer_reviews.author: W. Gene

customer_reviews.title: Great Remote, much better than the 880
customer_reviews.text: I had an 880 for 3 weeks then returned it because of IR range issue's. While the 890 may look like the 880 it is a totaly different remote in terms of IR range and stability. The 880 had a very narrow IR beam that was only reliable at 10-12ft while the 890 has about twice the range and a much wider angle. The 880 had a well known bug in the tilt sensor mechanism and charging cradle but the 890 does not have either of these problems. Couple those pluses along with the RF module and it is a much better value than the 880.
customer_reviews.author: RobbygTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: The Crown of the Wish List
customer_reviews.text: We love it, and it works with all our equipment which is great. Our old universal remote (issued from the cable company) only worked with half our items so we still had remotes laying around. I really like the "watch a movie" or "play a game" features. They turn on all the items required to do the task you select. We don't have to go through any walls, so I can't comment on that feature, but in our small living room it works great. Warning, this makes being a couch potato even easier. ;-)
customer_reviews.author: C. Hazzle

customer_reviews.title: Logitech doesn't support their product
customer_reviews.text: If you buy a Harmony remote do so at your own risk if you have a problem as the Harmony support is awful. I purchased this item and within 60 days it was defective. When I called Logitech they would not support or replace the defective unit. Thanks to Amazon I was able to replace it. I've owned two other Harmony remotes and always had good luck with them but their Customer Support has definitely changed for the worse. I would not recommend any Logitech product based on my experience.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Cristofono

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Remote
customer_reviews.text: This remote is not for the impatient nor the weak computer skilled. If you are looking for a plug-&-play remote, this one is not for you. But if you will take the time (I setup 2 TVs, 2 DVD/VCRs, surround sound, cable box and Wii and it took several adjustments and about 5 hours) you will be very pleased with the final results... even the wife, who was never able to navigate my 5 remotes, loves this thing. Again, just remember this is not a Plug-&-Play remote, but the effort is worth it.
customer_reviews.author: HGAZ

customer_reviews.title: Logitech Is The Best On The Market. Harmony 890 Superior Design
customer_reviews.text: The Harmony 890 does what it promises: It controls multiple divises, whether they are hidden (behind cabinets) or in the open. The only design issue I find it that the small buttons are hard to find in a dark room and hard to push one-handed. But, I am pleased with the way it manages my hidden DVR and DVD and is intuitive in connecting the various functions with my Sony HD television. I also have the Harmony One in another room where my devises are not hidden. Logitech has done a great job in designing both products.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Moser

customer_reviews.title: this remote control stops working after 3 months. even ...
customer_reviews.text: this remote control stops working after 3 months. even while it was working, there seems to be something loose with the battery connection because each time it was bounced, even on a soft surface, it would stop working, and i would have to take the battery out and put it back in before it will work again ! i guess there is no customer service support since the product had been discontinued !
customer_reviews.author: nguyend

customer_reviews.title: Great product with one minor hiccup
customer_reviews.text: Having owned the Harmony 880, I couldn't pass on the chance to upgrade to the 890 to get the RF functionality. And I've been very pleased. The only problem is that on occasion, the remote will freeze up for about 10 seconds when I lift it off the base--no picture, no function. Then it starts working fine again. Hopefully this is something that Logitech will address in a firmware upgrade. Otherwise, it's a great product and is the easiest remote to use that I've ever owned.
customer_reviews.author: W. McKinney

customer_reviews.title: Great remote, great experience on a return
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this remote at the end of December 2008 from Amazon. Setup was very easy when connected to my PC for the updates, step by step software, etc. Everything works as advertised including being able to walk outside and use the RF on my patio for Zone 2 on my receiver. Very convenient. However, I am writing about Logitech's customer service. The display slowly started to fail, and eventually stopped working all together. Hold time at 7PM CDT was only about 3-4 minutes, and 5 minutes later I had a new remote on the way! 5 stars for having a good product AND backing it up.
customer_reviews.author: J.S.

customer_reviews.title: So glad I could still find this model
customer_reviews.text: Needed to replace one I had for years and my elderly husband was used to using the old one. So glad I could still find this model.
customer_reviews.author: January

customer_reviews.title: Very handy
customer_reviews.text: Pretty looking and easy to operate. Initial programming can confuse lot of people. Programming with the computer needs some more than average computer skills. Once programmed you can control all the devices in your home. Turns on (glow) as you grab it in your hand. One button press turns on multiple devices. Button layout for Volume and channel change could have been located elsewhere and made a bit bigger. A little expensive. Resolution should have been more for the LCD.
customer_reviews.author: Yafis Rai

customer_reviews.title: Logitech Harmony 890 Remote Control is great
customer_reviews.text: The Logitech Harmony 890 remote is simply awesome. It does everything I wanted it to do, which was to replace six other remotes with one. I recommend you read other reviews because some customers had problems programming the remote. I had a few issues that I bumped into using the Logitech website, but nothing serious. Logitech is continually updating their website to make it easier to use. Plan to spend a few days programming the remote and tweeking the settings. Once you get the remote programmed, it operates seemlessly with all your components.
customer_reviews.author: L. MEYER

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised and fairly easy to set up. I control a TV, AV Receiver, Cable box, HD DVD, and Xbox 360 with this single remote. And most devices are located out of sight, in a wooden closed cabinet - the wireless extender works great for this. Just press one button for each activity and the correct devices power up with the correct settings for that activity. (i.e. Watch a DVD, play xbox, just watch cable) The only negative aspect that I've run into is that any change later on requires that you update both the remote and the wireless extender, via a usb cable to your computer. I have a laptop, so it's just a minor nuisance.
customer_reviews.author: P. Bales

customer_reviews.title: Remote Made a Believer of Me
customer_reviews.text: I have been skeptical of do all remotes. This remote is awsome. I use it to to control my 50" DLP Sampson TV, Sampson DVD, Cox Cable Box, and Yamaha ampifier with Bose surround sound speakers. The controls are setup by connectiong the remote to my computer via USB port and then using the menu to select the commands. After setup it is so easy that my wife can use it. Not only can the various remotes be eliminated, but it ensures that the DLP TV is safely shut down.
customer_reviews.author: R. C. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Customer Service is poor
customer_reviews.text: I bought a unit a couple of weeks ago. The charger and the remote did not work together, so I could not charge the unit, thus it did not work. I'm ok with an occasional defect with a unit, but when I called the support people and spent about an hour with them, I was told that someone from their RMA department would call me within 5 business days. I have not heard from them yet. I will return my unit to the retailer, as it is still within 30 days. I am weary of this type of customer service. Five business days to rerurn a call or email a customer who has bought a defective product is not acceptable.
customer_reviews.author: James M. Overton

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: This remote has made everything easier. I use it to work through cabinet doors and being able to hide all the equipment makes everything look cleaner. I'm thinking of getting the harmony 880 version (which doesn't work through walls, cabinets, etc.) for another room because it is so like the 890. If you are looking for something to work through walls, this remote is excellent. It's so easy to use, I no longer get phone calls in the middle of class from parents asking how to turn on the TV!
customer_reviews.author: Darlene

customer_reviews.title: Best remote ever.
customer_reviews.text: This is the second universal RF remote I have bought to try to control my equipment (JVC Receiver, Philips DVD recorder, DirecTV DVR Receiver, D-Link DSM-320 wireless media player) and I don't believe I will ever need another unless this one breaks. As soon as I find there is a function that I need that I didn't plan for I just hook it back up to the computer make a couple of adjustments and I'm back in operation. Great remote.
customer_reviews.author: K. Brown

customer_reviews.title: As advertised...AWESOME!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to avoid the high cost of a hard wired remote extender. I paid $150.00 to set up the home theater in my family room with a hard wire system. This seemed too good to be true! State of the art remote and wireless RF extender? I was ready to pay $399.00 at Ultimate Electronics...paid half on-line. Set up was a little complicated but the system works beautifully. A++++ Thank you Logitech! :-)
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer L. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Best one they ever made.  To bad it's discontinued.
customer_reviews.text: Best Harmony remote ever made. Has RF and IR,.. and you can shut off the IR,.. so it only uses the extender. Control your gear from another room,.. while cuddling with your spouse with the remote under the blanket,.. etc. And unlike the tablet style units,.. you can use this without balancing it on your lap,.. using 2 hands and looking at it.
customer_reviews.author: Stuster

customer_reviews.title: Great remote
customer_reviews.text: This remote is the best buy I have made in some time. The setup took a little learning but was easy on the web site. Glitches in first setup were well documented on the site (dealing with Dish receivers). It is so simple to watch TV, DVD, DVR (three of them for different TV's) and listen to my radio that I'm sorry I didn't buy the remote sooner. Had this remote about a month now and had great results. Support via the web was great. Quick response and helpful. The only reason this remote got 5 stars was because that was the highest rating on this site.
customer_reviews.author: Alfred M. Freitas

customer_reviews.title: Love this remote!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband for Christmas. We both love it. He said the set up was easy. The initial set up took about 30 minutes. We programmed 5 devices. Then we fine tuned it after we used it for a few days. But even that was easy. He even did some unique programming because of our media extender and he was quite impressed with it. It is easy to use and makes our lives much easier. This was a great buy. And of course Amazon.com was the cheapest online.
customer_reviews.author: H. Mommaerts

customer_reviews.title: Supurb!
customer_reviews.text: Too many good things about this remote to list. I'm usually a very tough critic when it comes to electronics. The 890 is absolutly awesome. I'm extremely happy. The only neg that I can come up with is that the unit requires a device (sold seperatly) to control a PS3. But thats because PS3 is bluetooth. Can't go wrong with this remote. 1000000% recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Renee

customer_reviews.title: Essential if you want to hide components
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the remote solely because I needed to put A/V components in a closet and this seemed to be the only solution short of paying thousands to an installer. After some wrangling with the setup due to a problem of my own doing (Logitech's customer service is fantastic I should note) and a secondary glitch that required a software upgrade, the remote works great. Not only does it control my closet equipment flawlessly--it actually works better than my cable remote did to control the cable box. Switching between TV with surround, DVD and CD could not be easier. Even my 78 year old mother in law could use it with merely a 1 minute tutorial.
customer_reviews.author: cosmo

customer_reviews.title: does it all....dont hesitate
customer_reviews.text: i purchased 18 months ago and initially didnt really try to get it to work.....but, then i lost the original remote and once again tried this one...to my amazement, it does everything it should do...easy to program with your computer..realy a neat remote...it wont disapoint...regrets...none...ergonomically the buttons could be a bit larger and the battery charge could last a little longer, but thats ok...its seems to be the best remote ever...i have had several programable remotes, but none like this...buy it...be happy
customer_reviews.author: B. sayers

customer_reviews.title: Love this remote!
customer_reviews.text: This remote does exactly what it is meant to do, control everything. I was amazed at how well the default button setup was for all of my electronics. A few tweaks and everything works. I haven't even set up the RF portion yet. The IR is so powerful that many of the things that had trouble with their own remotes are working great now. My wife loves the "one remote" for everything and less clutter on the coffee table. Yeah, it's a little expensive but sure worth it in my household.
customer_reviews.author: PaulR

customer_reviews.title: Good, But
customer_reviews.text: This thing worked well for about 14 months then just completely stopped working. I don't consider something of this price to be a disposable item so I was disappointed. Still, while it worked, it did it's job well, apart from the occasional lockup which forced me to remove the battery. Not sure I would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Londonnoise

customer_reviews.title: love or Hate
customer_reviews.text: I get why there is such disparity in the ratings. If you can get it to work it is a wonderful product, otherwise, it can make you want to smash it in to pieces. What I found was to recognize there were reasons for people having strong feelings over whether this is a productive remote. The directions don't help you to make it work. Trial and error and not becoming frustrated and learning by my mistakes made me able to get a great outcome. BTW: I am fairly literate and capable with computers. However, most people could muddle through to a satisfactory answer.
customer_reviews.author: John Gannon

customer_reviews.title: It works, not anything amazing though
customer_reviews.text: It's great that Logitech put up a database online. Everything I needed was right there, but I think you should be able to download what you need and then work from your computer instead of a logitech server. I have to kill my router firewall every time I reconfigure. The remote does generally work perfectly. Its definitely nicer than the IR PDA program I was using before.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Lyssy

customer_reviews.title: Happy with Remote
customer_reviews.text: This universal remote is much better than the infrared system we were using before. I had a friend help to set it up as it took a while and many steps. The remote is easy to use. It has streamlined our channel-watching at home. The only challenge I've faced is that sometimes one of the many components (TV,DVR,Stereo, etc) will not turn on/off with the others. The help menu quickly gets me back on track.
customer_reviews.author: J. Torrez

customer_reviews.title: Harmony 890 remote
customer_reviews.text: Great replacement. Original 890 I had lasted 13 years before the screen failed and remote started malfunctioning.
customer_reviews.author: Gary C. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Less than totally pleased
customer_reviews.text: Have had this remote for about 3 months now. Initial setup was relatively simple and results were quite satisfactory early on. Found the "favorites" capability to be somewhat limited compared to the type of custom programming that's doable with remotes in the Philips ProntoPro line. Real headache came when I started to upgrade my program. Couldn't seem to get the revised program to download to both the remote and the extender. Two Emails to Logitech generated no response. Am seriously considering buying a second ProntoPro for the house and investing the hours to program it. I'm skeptical about any further modifications to the Harmony.
customer_reviews.author: Rob 'n Julie C

customer_reviews.title: Better than the 880
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the 890 when I went on vacation and had a friend stay at my house. The Harmony 880 I had was so quirky that I was afraid she will be completely lost so I got the 890 for a trial. So far so good. The 890 is much faster and much more reliable than the 880. The online software download is still just as quirky but usually it is a one time set up so that is not a big deal. Would recommend this to anyone who needs to control multiple devices in one room and maybe one more room. For multi-room configurations, this most likely won't work as well.
customer_reviews.author: Hanumancat

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and program!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after my wife and I decided to build a new house and she wanted my to store my numerous audio/visual gadgets in a closet. The IR functionality rocks and I think the thing is easy to program. It does everything that I need which includes controlling a dvd player, hd dvd player, tivo, direct tv hd sat, sony tv, sony amp, and a vcr. I think the price on this beats MANY other options out there!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: a great product from Harmony
customer_reviews.text: As always, a great product from Harmony. I put all my equipment in a closet and now have a clean look around my TV. Controlling all of my equipment in the closet is very easy. Outstanding product.
customer_reviews.author: Golfstar83

customer_reviews.title: Good overall, could use some advanced features
customer_reviews.text: Generally good, and once it's set up right and working just so it's a breeze to use, however getting to that point can be a little time-consuming and frustrating. The command set determined from the model number you enter doesn't always match what's present on the remote, which can be frustrating. Wireless updating would nice, as would bluetooth, especially given the price tag. The RF controller is an extremely useful accessory (included in box), as it allows everything to be hidden away in cabinets. Support for Linux would also be nice - currently the software is PC/Mac only. Overall though, I would recommend this. It definitely eliminates the need for multiple remotes and is easy to use once set up.
customer_reviews.author: C. D. Gee

customer_reviews.title: Best remote for me
customer_reviews.text: I have had several advanced remotes, including the Harmony 659. This one beats all of them for its ease of use, placement of buttons, and rechargeable battery. As is the case for all Harmony remotes, setup is a breeze on the web. My only complaint is that it is not yet VISTA compatible and I had to load the software on a computer with XP.
customer_reviews.author: L. S. Brodsky

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: Great unit. Wish it were not discontinued. I will buy one again if this one only lasts 3-4 years like other one. I love the way it works. All units hidden in the closet out of view. This leaves the TV as only component seen by friends and family. (DVD, Stereo receiver, Cable box)
customer_reviews.author: Bricklayer

customer_reviews.title: Love this item!
customer_reviews.text: I picked one of these up when they first come out through Amazon and paid much more then. It has worked great for me running everything. My only complaint is sometimes the numbers aren't as responsive as they should be but I can't complain. If it failed today and I couldn't get it fixed I would buy another ASAP!
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Adkins

customer_reviews.title: Do not waste your money
customer_reviews.text: I have have had three of these remotes, and they are worthless. I had to replace the first one right after it went out of warranty. The face of it went out, and it was obvious when I called for support on it that this was a know issue with the company. Any time I have called for actual support on the other two it was non-existent. You get the runaround about which number to call for support then there is no support at all once you get to the correct number. They also do not hold a charge. One of my remotes continuously repeats commands to the point that it is almost useless.
customer_reviews.author: San284

customer_reviews.title: Truly Universal Remote
customer_reviews.text: My new home theater configuration is a little complicated. It works fine if you know what you are doing. With this remote, my wife is able to use the system. Programming the remote is not hard. Making changes is less than intuitive; you need to reselect all options for a device (but it does default in the original settings). The 890PRO would be a better choice because it can control two separate TV systems. With wires strung all over my house, I can watch and control my TiVo from anywhere in the house.
customer_reviews.author: Phil G

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: I have had very good success with this remote. I did not use the CD for the install, rather went to the website. This remote has really simplified my life. I recommend it highly. The only thing I would recommend is the IR repeater base shoud have the power supply detachable. This way, when you go to update it via the computer, you do not have to mess with pulling out the power supply, because whenever you update the remote, the repeater needs to be updated as well.
customer_reviews.author: Sean M. Harvey

customer_reviews.title: Good, but not good enough.
customer_reviews.text: Actually, the range was poor on this unit so I had to return it. No issues with the return. The older model had better range so I know it's possible.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Lascari

customer_reviews.title: This house can't function without them.
customer_reviews.text: This house can't function without them (We have two.) Wish they had replaceable batteries instead of a charging cradle.
customer_reviews.author: El See

customer_reviews.title: Great Addition to our Den
customer_reviews.text: This remote replaced five remotes in our den. The remote does not feel real sturdy in your hand, but works great. You need to research and read before trying to set it up on your own. Customer support is free for 90 days, so set it up quickly and use them.
customer_reviews.author: Cedar Hill

customer_reviews.title: Very versatile remote
customer_reviews.text: I have all of my AV gear in a recessed cabinet behind my screen so I needed a remote with RF capabilities. The 890 fit the bill perfectly and is great for building macros with ease. This allows the rest of the family to watch dvd's or satellite without turning on all of the required components, 1 simple button does the work for you. My first one had a bad RF receiver, but Amazon amazingly sent me a replacement the next day!
customer_reviews.author: M. Page

customer_reviews.title: Very Pleased
customer_reviews.text: I'm really pleased with the Harmony 890 and extender. Just placing the extender in a closed cabinet with the components works well without making any direct connections to the components from the extender. At one point I needed some direct help with programming activities. A call to Logitech, and a technician gave excellent help. This is available only for sixty days following purchase. Occasionally an activity is not completed correctly, but using help makes a correction.
customer_reviews.author: J. R. Rowland

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the cheaper $$ on line
customer_reviews.text: This is a very expensive remote in stores and other places I looked. The remote works well and is fairly simple. You do need to read the directions and will have to have internet access when programing it. The only thing I wish it has was Bluetooth since my PS3 is bluetooth only and not RF or IR.
customer_reviews.author: The Butcher

customer_reviews.title: I was sold a defective remote. Tried contacting seller ...
customer_reviews.text: I was sold a defective remote. Tried contacting seller but no response. Thought about getting it repaired but be WARNED! Spoke to Logitech and I was told that Logitech remotes CAN NOT BE REPAIRED!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Rick Dewitt

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding device to control all of your electronic devices
customer_reviews.text: Logitech Harmony 890 was very easy to set up and operate. All I had to do was to answer some questions as to how and what devices I wanted to set up and/or run together. The price definitely fit the pocketbook. It addressed all of the needs of my media center. It so simple to use my wife can use it without any complaints. Simply pick which activity "watch a movie" "play a game""watch TV""listen to music". Again a great device to control your media needs.
customer_reviews.author: J. Daniels

customer_reviews.title: logitech Harmony 890
customer_reviews.text: The remote is awsome. It can do all functions to multiple devices with just one click. A rechargeable docking station makes it very convenient. The seller was great. The first remote had a small glitch, and the seller took care of me at an incredibly fast rate.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Angelo

customer_reviews.title: Universal Remote Control
customer_reviews.text: The remote looks really nice. It takes some time to have it programmed but it is not too complicated. It is a bit "buggy" and I already had to re-program mine after having it for 3 months. The battery doesn't last too long so it needs to charge every couple of days.
customer_reviews.author: Anna S.

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my wife as she has always had a difficult time knowing which remote to use for which device and what to turn on, etc. I got the remote and in the course of a couple of hours had it programmed and working. I asked her last weekend how she likes it and her comments were that she loved the remote and that it works great for her.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Lewis

customer_reviews.title: intel macs-forget it
customer_reviews.text: After repeated installations and removal of software (no easy simple deletion task), never was able to get the software to operate. I have a macbook pro with osx.5. Save yourself a lot of frustration and time by avoiding this product.
customer_reviews.author: Lewis

customer_reviews.title: geez I'm in for a real headach
customer_reviews.text: Hello,This thing is no where near plug and play.After hours of set up the 890 only kinda worked.Then after literaly 20hrs of try try try with the softwear the unit just stopped working.geez are all expensive remotes this inaddiquit? I certainly think so.As for the 890 I'll keep at it until it works or I stick it in the drawer with my marantz, pronto and the other remotes that don't meet my high standards for electronics.
customer_reviews.author: Randy Pullman

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: This is the first Harmony remote that we own and are very impressed and satisfied with it thus far. I have noticed, however, that perhaps a key lock feature would be nice. There have been a few occasions we have sat on the remote accidentally and the channel changes on its own. Other than that, the product superb. Oh, the price was outstanding since we priced it at a large electronics retailer and it was about $100 more than what I paid for here on Amazon.com
customer_reviews.author: CV

customer_reviews.title: Logitech Harmony 890 solves the problem
customer_reviews.text: I had to move my receiver and the cable box out of the room with the TV due to lack of space within my TV cabinet for all components. To the basement they went and I decided to get the Harmony 890 to allow me to control all Home Theater components. I installed it yesterday and despite a couple of minor glitches, it works well and solved my space issues. I would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Arthur J. Vrecenak

customer_reviews.title: Good Stuff.
customer_reviews.text: Good Remote.. My only complaint would be that its gray and blue back light buttons and is hard to see. Id get a black remote next time. But its easy to use and works well for me. However, others have trouble with it because they hit buttons and dont wait for all the devices to turn on before they put it down. You will need to keep the remote pointed at the devices till they all turn on, or off. Which im sure is normal.
customer_reviews.author: Rock

customer_reviews.title: logitech harmony 890
customer_reviews.text: the logitech 890 is great,we have tried other all in one remotes but they are a shadow next to the harmony.The others gave you basic functions,but,you could not work the special functions without using the original remote,where as the harmony gives you full function capability.Icould not be happier with this product.way to go logitech!!
customer_reviews.author: michael

customer_reviews.title: Very good remote
customer_reviews.text: This remote works well as advertised. It is simple to program. The only drawback is that there were a couple of keystrokes that I am not able to program into the device. I posed the problem to customer service and they responded quickly. It is minor and only requires pressing one button extra after turning on to watch TV. I would recommend as a universal remote that ANYONE can use.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Remote control for tv system
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent product. Easy to use, easy to install. Excellent customer service, english speaking! Great replacement for the over priced Pronto. After using it, I purchase another one! No more expensive AV calls to reprogram the Phillips Ponto.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Logitech Harmony 890 Advanced remote control
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding product!seamless transaction, Great price. Extremely easy to program. Didn't last long difficult to reprogram. after using for a while discovered that it was not as "universal" as i thought it would be.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: No Harmony about it
customer_reviews.text: Great idea, poor follow through. Got the remote to download properly after a few hours, but the Infa-red portion never worked. Sent e-mail to Logitech, they responded after I opted to return item (took 4 days for return e-mail)
customer_reviews.author: Claymiac

customer_reviews.title: Great, but not perfect
customer_reviews.text: I had a Harmony several years ago and it was just OK. It didn't do real well working with a Mac OS, this one does just fine. It is nice to have a charger on this one. It is a bit time consuming to set up and then having to fine tune, but it has been working as advertised for a couple of weeks now. It is a hassle to unplug the remote sensor and lug all of it to your computer, but that is the only downside. Would I recommend purchasing this remote? Yes, and I would do it again. Larry
customer_reviews.author: Larry Fickel

customer_reviews.title: One of the best universal remotes I have ever used.
customer_reviews.text: Works amazing with all the TVs i have used it with.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Benson

customer_reviews.title: Universal Remote by Logitech works great!
customer_reviews.text: Finally, a universal remote that works. Sure, it was a bit of a hassle to program it, but I expected that it would take some effort. All in all, it is as advertised and more . . . you can put away all those other remotes.
customer_reviews.author: Coolmaker

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced!!! Try something else....
customer_reviews.text: The remote battery was damaged, It was so blooded it wouldn't even fit in the remote. For the price I paid for this remote, at least I shouldn't have to pay for a battery too.
customer_reviews.author: flyers rule

customer_reviews.title: Replacing Harmony 880
customer_reviews.text: Harmony 890 is very easy to set up and use and the RF capability makes it possible for me to keep my components wherever I choose. I previously owned a Harmony 880 which is basically identical to the 890 but IR only. After 3.5 years the screen on the 880 is almost unreadable and the volume control is pretty much unusable so I gave this product a lower rating for durability. Not as big an issue with the 880 which is now under $100 but the 890 is almost 3 times that price and I will very dissapointed if I have to replace the unit in a couple of years.
customer_reviews.author: Steve S

customer_reviews.title: very confusing to program
customer_reviews.text: received quickly, but way to complicated to program and the price that it is, its not worth the headache at all
customer_reviews.author: Denise

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Support from Manufacturer
customer_reviews.text: After I set up the remote, I couldn't re-sync to my computer and update it. It turned out to be a problem with my computers settings, which Logitech support caught in the first few minutes of the call. However, the tech spent the better part of an hour on the phone with me setting up my remote, at his end, so it would work better. Excellent service. This remote's expensive, but you get what you paid for.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Calamita

customer_reviews.title: Very useful remote
customer_reviews.text: A really good remote that works with a LOT of different electronics manufacturers products. Just what the doctor ordered! Solves the primary need of replacing all of the remotes for our AV system.
customer_reviews.author: bjordan1138

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Buttons are too small and make operation with one hand almost impossible for the volume and channel changes.
customer_reviews.author: david perkins

customer_reviews.title: Programming Additional Buttons.
customer_reviews.text: Great product! The initial setup is not as intuitive as it could be, but this is more of a "language" issue since some of the terminology is not well explained. However, I am enjoying this remote very much and only have good things to say about it. And just yesterday I added an "Additional Button" to my "Watch TV" activity. That was truly easy to do and my wife was very pleased to have the new button, which brings up the list of recorded shows on our Satellite box.
customer_reviews.author: R. Valverde

customer_reviews.title: Great Remote
customer_reviews.text: This is my third Harmony remote and my favorite. I also have a 680 and a 676 in other rooms. I needed a stronger signal and the RF feature of this remote works beautifully. I love the Harmony setup software. Very easy to setup the remote for your particular equipment and customize the operation to suit individual needs.
customer_reviews.author: J. Morton

customer_reviews.title: works ok but i see why its discontinued
customer_reviews.text: the buttons are very small and hard to see for my older customers. also eventually the charging contacts on the remote and base station stop making contact so you cannot recharge the battery

customer_reviews.title: What a Relief!
customer_reviews.text: I used this remote to replace another remote that was programmable only by pressing buttons on the remote. This remote, being programmable by connecting to a computer, was a joy to program. And the software Logitech provides is VERY easy to use, and easily controls the wierdest products besides consumer electronics, or electronics that other remotes won't control, such as space heaters and light switches and Audiovox TVs. It's a joy to use.
customer_reviews.author: N. A. Kees

customer_reviews.title: Excellent remote control
customer_reviews.text: GOOD REMOTE CONTROL. VERY EASY TO OPERATE. FRIENDLY COMPUTER INSTRUCTIONS AND DOWNLOADS. I CAN NOW OPERATE MY ENTIRE HOME THEATER WITH THIS REMOTE CONTROL. I HAVE 12 DIFFERENT DEVICES FROM DIFFERENT BRANDS AND THEY ALL WORK PERFECTLY BY USING MY NEW REMOTE. HIGHLY RECOMENDED
customer_reviews.author: E. diaz

customer_reviews.title: Great remote
customer_reviews.text: Does everything you want and more! I would recommend this to everyone, experienced or not. RF feature is a must for all remotes.
customer_reviews.author: Adam H.

customer_reviews.title: fantastic
customer_reviews.text: This unit work flawless. Lots of forethought went into design and the setup and update system is 100%. I 've setup my duaghters with one and it save a lot of "How do I" phone calls... Everyone needs one.
customer_reviews.author: Digitart

customer_reviews.title: Non-functional software
customer_reviews.text: Wow. Not only was the CD defective, but neither the Mac version or Windows software would successfully update the remote. Looking at the support forums, seems to be a common issue, and people have complained that Logitech has not been very helpful solving the issues.
customer_reviews.author: M. Spencer

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: The Harmony 890 works as advertised. I programmed it with little trouble, and it's worked very well for a few months, with no issues. Based on the reviews, I was a bit hesitant. But, my experience has been very positive.
customer_reviews.author: J. Bloom

customer_reviews.title: Good Remote
customer_reviews.text: This remote was very easy to setup and use. You just program everything from you computer and it will update your remote and extender. If you are an average experienced computer, this will be a piece of cake.
customer_reviews.author: A. Luk

customer_reviews.title: Great again
customer_reviews.text: This is a replacement for an old remote whose ability to be recharged had gone bad (design flaw but it was 6 years old). The best part about the replacement is Harmony's keeping of the profile for my remote on line and with a simple sync process I had a new remote. Loved it before and still love it now.
customer_reviews.author: Dr Kenneth L Geoly

customer_reviews.title: generally good
customer_reviews.text: While it takes some tweaking and, in my case, several calls to friendly, useful customer service, it's a good buy. The data base has all of my equipment and therefore set up the device readily. Clearly, a manual would have been of great value and would have saved a lot of their time and mine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Tenacious Techie
customer_reviews.text: The good: All your gear is hidden in a closet. Good Controller. Tivo 30 second skip works. Good step by step instructions. The bad: Many trips back and forth to your computer to set up the devices and make changes. Each requires downloads to 2 devices which take several minutes each. You better be a tenacious techie.
customer_reviews.author: Albert K. Mellinger

customer_reviews.title: it's prime time now...
customer_reviews.text: This remote's came a long way in a year. Lucky for me I didn't purchase one until december of 2006. It's been working fairly flawlessly for me.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Broke after less than a year and manufacturer didn't honor the warranty. Definitely do not buy!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan S. Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Rock Solid Remote
customer_reviews.text: I have bought two of these units and am anxiously awaiting it's upgrade with the Harmony One (with RF)because that would be the best remote on the market. Would have given this a 5 star rating, but Logitech still has some tweaking to do with their software setup. It takes you a while to learn all of its quirks. Would recommend this remote to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: N. Kremer

customer_reviews.title: Harmony
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product, easy to setup and works extremely well. ONly concern I have is the speed at which the application works when communicating witht the database. Other than that, it works extremely well!
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Good product, bad description. According to the box all A/V devices work with this remote, which is not correct. Per the tech support of Logitech, remote does not work with Bose A/V devices.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Breaks really easily
customer_reviews.text: I've had four of these remotes and everyone eventually broke due to dropping once. The remote works great through rooms,walls. The buttons are too close together and the remote is really fragile.
customer_reviews.author: Donald Gagnard

product_meta.title: Logitech Harmony 890 Advanced Universal Remote Control (Discontinued by Manufacturer)
product_meta.description:
FROM THE MANUFACTURER


Imagine… controlling all your devices using only one remote - without a direct line of sight to the components! With the Harmony 890 Remote, you can wirelessly control your home entertainment system while hiding all those unsightly wires and components behind cabinet doors or a wall.

Logitech's Harmony 890, an upgrade to the Harmony 880 remote control, uses both radio frequency (RF) and infrared (IR) wireless signals to deliver powerful complete control of your home-entertainment system that may be hidden behind cabinets. With a wireless range of up to 100 feet, the Harmony 890 remote sends RF commands to a wireless receiver, which then blasts infrared signals to the components. The Harmony 890 remote makes universal control for home entertainment and advanced lighting systems simple. 

Using Your Harmony Remote

1. Easy to set up: 
Just connect your Harmony remote to your computer and the Web wizard walks you step-by-step through a simple set up. Enter the model numbers of your components, then answer a few easy questions about how you "Watch TV" or "Watch a DVD." Harmony lets you control even the most complex system without the hassle of programming complicated macros.

2. Easy to use: 
The Harmony Remote is the world's only remote with Smart State Technology®. Simply press an Activity button, such as "Watch TV" or "Listen to Music," and your Harmony Remote automatically sets up each of the devices required for that activity.

3. Easy to get help: 
With the Harmony remote, you don't have to know anything about your entertainment system to operate it. No sound? No picture? No problem! There's even a handy "HELP" button to guide you through simple troubleshooting and get you back in control. 

4. Never out of date: 
The Harmony device database includes 5,000+ manufacturers and 175,000+ devices, everything from HDTVs to DVRs, VCRs to lighting controls. It's constantly updated with new components and fine-tuned settings, so your remote will never be out-of-date. 

Features

Color display
Both functional and stylish, with user-customizable backgrounds, button icons and text. Comfort-grip shape
For easy control.
Fully backlit
Easily navigate in the dark. Harmony RF Wireless Extender
Serves as a bridge receiver which converts RF signals to IR commands, for control without a direct line of sight!  * Control your entire home entertainment system with just one button.Effortlessly switch between watching home theater and listening to music, by selecting a single activity button. Colorful icons accompany text on the LCD screen to allow for quick and easy command of home-entertainment equipment and household appliances that may be out of range for a traditional infrared remote. 
 * Integrate up to 15 devices—including lighting and household appliances. 
 * Save energy! Each time a new activity is selected, the remote establishes the proper state of all of the components needed for the current activity, and turns off the components that are not needed. 
 * Set it up in a snap with an advanced setup wizard. The online setup also makes it easy to update a remote when upgrading your home-entertainment system. The Harmony setup wizard does the programming, so you don't have to. Just connect your remote to your computer and answer a few questions about how you currently use your home theater. Logitech's patented Smart State Technology® does the rest. 
 * Don't worry about using up batterieswith the rechargeable lithium ion battery. Store the remote on the attractive charging station when not in use. 
 * Easily view and select. Color display icons and 8 on-screen activity buttons make it easy. 
 * Effortlessly switch between watching HDTV and listening to music, by selecting a single activity button.
